title: Mirror or Archive of linesandsplines.com?
content:
I was following some typography links that I had saved years before, when I ran into a dead-end at the long defunct but always spectacular [http://linesandsplines.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102075405/http:/linesandsplines.com/ "http://linesandsplines.com"). Did anybody out there save an archive of the site?

I’d be indebted forever to anyone who did. By that I mean I’ll get you something nice at Veer or something.

Enrico

 [‹ Made with FontFont review](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102075405/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33569 "Go to previous forum topic") [Looking for similar font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102075405/http:/www.typophile.com/node/33557 "Go to next forum topic")
author: enrico_limcaco

comments.content:
Will you get me something nice at [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102075405/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Lineto)? I kid. Sadly, I don’t have an archive of L&S. But archive.org does have a cache of Crewdson’s [New Series](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102075405/http:/typographi.com/000254.php):

[http://web.archive.org/web/\*/http://new-series.org](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102075405/http:/web.archive.org/web/*/http:/new-series.org)

Yes! I love the internets.

LineTo lists their prices in hundreds of CHFs. I dunno what CHFs are, but I don’t think I have hundreds of them :0)

enrico

The archives for lines and spines does exist. Last I heard from Andy he still has it. I do as well, but in print only, and not certain exactly where it may be!!!

Andy went AWOL awhile back. Not certain how to get in touch with him.

Gerald

The Bieler Press  
 [http://BielerPress.blogspot.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080102075405/http:/bielerpress.blogspot.com/ "http://BielerPress.blogspot.com")
